nodes.text: Imperial remnants, also known as Imperial holdouts, were the various fractured organizations—factions, states, fiefdoms, and holdouts—that came into existence upon the dissolution of the Galactic Empire in 5 ABY as well as after the death of Emperor Palpatine during the Battle of Endor in 4 ABY. These factions, some of which existed for years following the end of the Galactic Civil War, include:

After the death of Emperor Palpatine at the Battle of Endor, several Imperial factions split away from the Empire to hold over their own territories while others fell to infighting in vying for power and control over the Empire in the vacuum caused by the Emperor's death, causing the Empire to fracture and fragment.

After the civil war ended, several Imperial successor states and holdouts would emerge, some of which would settle for peace with the New Republic, while others rebelled against the new galactic government in the galaxy.
